title: [...] or, Cupids wrongs vindicated wherein he that Cupids wiles did discover, is proved a false dissembling lover. The mayd shewes such cause that none can her condemne, but on the contrary the fault's layd on him. To the tune of Cupids cruell torments.
author: M. P. (Martin Parker), d. 1656?
notes: Signed: M. P., i.e. Martin Parker.
In two parts, with woodcut at head of each part.
Printer's name and publication date from STC.
Entered as "The faire maides appology or Cupids .." to F. Grove May 29, 1633--STC.
Imperfect; margins cropped, first words of title lacking.
Reproductions of the original in the British Library.
